titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Architectural Drawings and Maps of Yale University Buildings and Grounds
Architectural Drawings and Maps of Yale University Buildings and Grounds Papers
titlestmt.author: compiled by staff of Manuscripts and Archives

publicationstmt.publisher: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Tuesday April 23, 2019 at 08:14

did.unittitle: Architectural drawings and maps of Yale University buildings and grounds

repository.corpname: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

did.abstract: The materials consist of design, preliminary, working, shop, and "as built" architectural drawings and maps of buildings and grounds owned or used by Yale University. The drawings range from original concepts to full scale details of equipment and ornamentation. The media vary from water colors, pen and ink sketches, pencil on tracing paper drawings to blueprints and photostats.

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Forms part of Yale Record Group 46-A (YRG 46-A), Records and materials broadly documenting Yale buildings, facilities, and grounds.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: The drawings and maps included in this collection have come from a variety of sources, including transfers from the Yale offices concerned with building design, construction, and maintenance; other Yale offices; and individual donors. Additional drawings and maps of Yale buildings and facilities that do not form an integral body of records on their own are added to this collection.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research. Series I is available on aperture cards, and patrons must use the aperture cards instead of the original drawings. Special permission from the Head of Manuscripts and Archives is required to use original drawings in Series I.

Original born digital files, as well as preservation masters, may not be accessed due to their fragility. Researchers must consult use copies, or if none exist request that they be made. Born digital files cannot be accessed remotely. System requirements include a Manuscripts and Archives computer and file viewing software.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Architectural Drawings and Maps of Yale University Buildings and Grounds (RU 1). Manuscripts and Archives, Yale University Library.

otherfindaid.head: Other Finding Aids
otherfindaid.p: A spreadsheet (.xls) listing boxes and aperture cards by building is also available.

altformavail.head: Existence and Location of Copies
altformavail.p: Series I is available on aperture cards.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The materials consist of design, preliminary, working, shop, and "as built" architectural drawings and maps of buildings and grounds owned or used by Yale University. The drawings range from original concepts to full scale details of equipment and ornamentation. The media vary from water colors, pen and ink sketches, pencil on tracing paper drawings to blueprints and photostats.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The materials are arranged in two series: Series I. Drawings accessioned before 1980 and subsequently microfilmed. Series II. Drawings accessioned since 1980 and not microfilmed.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Series I is available on aperture cards. Patrons must use this format. Special permission from the Head of Manuscripts and Archives is required to use original drawings in Series I.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains architectural drawings which were accessioned prior to 1980. These drawings were microfilmed as part of the Yale Architectural Archives Project. Information about the drawing (e.g., building, job, drawing set, documentation type, date, architect) was coded and entered into a database. Aperture cards containing the coded information along with a negative image of the drawing are available in Manuscripts and Archives. The database was used to produce printed indexes to the drawings by building, architect, date of drawing, and image number.
Arranged by region/chronology code. See Appendix for full listing of buildings arranged by region/chronology.
A spreadsheet (.xls) listing boxes and aperture cards by building is also available.

did.unittitle: Elevations and plans of present and projected buildings of Yale College by John Trumbull (original and photstat)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Left to right, buildings identified by Trumbull as "Projected Building, Chapel, Present Building, Buildings which may be erected hereafter." Illustrates the beginnings of the Old Brick Row.

custodhist.head: Custodial History
custodhist.p: Given in the name and memory of Charles Gwathmey (MArch '62) to the Yale School of Architecture by Richard Nash Gould (YC '68; MArch '72), October 2007, on the occasion of the MArch 72's 35th reunion.

did.unittitle: Window drawings for Phase I renovations

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Drawings of windows detail the location of leading and brass. Each drawing includes a number where WD stands for window and the letter-number combination is a unique identifier assigned to each window. The amount of restoration needed and the date the window was removed for repair are also recorded.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Original born digital files, as well as preservation masters, may not be accessed due to their fragility. Researchers must consult use copies, or if none exist request that they be made. Born digital files cannot be accessed remotely. System requirements include a Manuscripts and Archives computer and file viewing software.
